    Robin ASPE, Quentin FLEGEAU

    • Constructor Detail

      • Main

        public Main(java.lang.String host,
            int port)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        host - The server hosting the application. Use IP, name of machine or localhost
        port - The port on which the server is listening

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method of main class - Entrance of application
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments given at launch: [-h] for usage or [server_host] [server_port]

      • usage

        public static void usage()
        Usage shown when using the -h option or when arguments are incorrects. Print the string on system standard output.

      • readingUsage

        public static void readingUsage()
        Usage shown when using the application is reading system input. Print the string on system standard output.

      • run

        public void run()
        Application start. Proceeds reading on standard input stream.

      • addInstructions

        public void addInstructions(java.lang.String[] command)
        Use a string array to run appropriate ADDING methods
        Parameters:
        command - The String array containing the method to call and the arguments, read by a scanner.

      • checkInstructions

        public void checkInstructions(java.lang.String[] command)
        Use a string array to run appropriate CHECKING methods
        Parameters:
        command - The String array containing the method to call and the arguments, read by a scanner.

      • addAccountInstruction

        public void addAccountInstruction(java.lang.String[] command)
        Add an account entry to the javaspace with arguments given in a string array
        Parameters:
        command - String array containing the account parameters (ADD ACCOUNT account_number account_balance)

      • checkAccountInstruction

        public void checkAccountInstruction(java.lang.String[] command)
        Check for an Account informations from the javaspace with search criteria given in a string array
        Parameters:
        command - String array containing the account search parameters (CHECK ACCOUNT account_number). Any field can be filled with '*', which is the joker argument.

      • addAirportInstruction

        public void addAirportInstruction(java.lang.String[] command)
        Add an airport entry to the javaspace with arguments given in a string array
        Parameters:
        command - String array containing the airport parameters (ADD AIRPORT airport_code city_name)

      • addFlightInstruction

        public void addFlightInstruction(java.lang.String[] command)
        Add a Flight entry to the javaspace with arguments given in a string array
        Parameters:
        command - String array containing the flight parameters (ADD FLIGHT flight_code departure_date(DD-MM-YYYY) departure_airport_code arrival_airport_code flight_price)

      • addSeatInstruction

        public void addSeatInstruction(java.lang.String[] command)
        Add a seat entry to the javaspace with arguments given in a string array
        Parameters:
        command - String array containing the airport parameters (ADD SEAT seat_number flight_code)

      • lookforInstruction

        public void lookforInstruction(java.lang.String[] command)
        Look for a Flight code from the javaspace with search criteria given in a string array
        Parameters:
        command - String array containing the flight search parameters (LOOKFOR date start_city arrival_city). Any field can be filled with '*', which is the joker argument.

      • reserveInstruction

        public void reserveInstruction(java.lang.String[] command)
        Reserve a seat into the javaspace from a flight code and an account number.
        Parameters:
        command - String array containing the flight code and the account number (RESERVE flight_code account_number).
